overview: From 2025-08-31 to 2025-09-07, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 38 new PRs (32 merged), 19 new issues, and 61 active contributors.

topIssues.title: op-node/p2p/gossip - ConfigureGossip overwrites sane defaults with zero values
topIssues.author: wood-jp
topIssues.body:
**Bug Description**

https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/develop/op-node/p2p/gossip.go#L146
```
	params := BuildGlobalGossipParams(rollupCfg)

	// override with CLI changes
	params.D = p.MeshD
	params.Dlo = p.MeshDLo
	params.Dhi = p.MeshDHi
	params.Dlazy = p.MeshDLazy
```
This sets the params values directly to those passed in. However, if the passed in struct does not have a value explicitly set (eg `MeshDHi`) then the zero value (0 in this case) is used, which replaced the sane default set earlier with `BuildGlobalGossipParams` (12 btw).

**Steps to Reproduce**
n/a - I've given you the exact code that is wrong.

**Expected behavior**
Should only overwrite these values when non-zero

**Environment Information:**
n/a

**Configurations:**
n/a

**Logs:**
n/a

**Additional context**
n/a

---

⚠️ **Notice:** Issues that do not include the following sections will be subject to closure:
- Bug Description
- Steps to Reproduce
- Environment Information

Please ensure all required sections are filled out accurately to expedite the debugging process and improve issue resolution efficiency.

topIssues.title: [acceptance]: flashblocks executes non-interop-transactions with supervisor RPC unavailable
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
In an interop setting, rbuilder can be configured with a supervisor URL. Though one expectation from rbuilder is to accept non-interop transactions in the case of that supervisor URL being unavailable.

Have an acceptance-test covering that scenario.

topIssues.title: [Tracker] Proofs: use Drippie to manage hot wallet funds for challenger
topIssues.author: pauldowman
topIssues.body: Funding the challenger would be easier to manage with Drippie. It is not yet being used on mainnet.  This will include monitoring.

topPRs.title: feat: dev feature flagging in OPCM
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body: Adds functionality to tests and OPCM that makes it possible to execute use feature flags in the OPCM that selectively utilize specific functionality. This flag is represented as a 32 byte bitmap for op-deployer compatibility and makes it possible to support 32 unique development features at the same time.

topPRs.title: feat: custom gas token
topPRs.author: hexshire
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Enables OP Stack chains to use an asset other than ETH as their native fee currency by introducing a minimal, flexible, and standardizable Custom Gas Token (CGT) architecture. To do so, it introduces new **predeploys** (`NativeAssetLiquidity` and `LiquidityController`) that decouple native asset management from core bridging operations while using a single `isCustomGasToken()` flag that disables ETH transfer flows in all bridging methods. The two new pre-deploys manage the native asset supply.

**Tests**

Core contracts:

- `OptimismPortal` and `L1Block`: Tests for `isCustomGasToken()` flag blocking ETH deposits/withdrawals
- `NativeAssetLiquidity`: Tests deposit/withdraw access control and functionality
- `LiquidityController`: Tests minter authorization, mint/burn operations, and metadata functions

**Metadata**

- Spec: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/749
- Design Doc: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/305

---------------------------------

### Contributors
  - @0xOneTony
  - @0xniha
  - @agusduha
  - @ashitakah
  - @hexshire
  - @Joxess
  - @tynes

topPRs.title: feat: creator pattern integerate FaultDisputeGameV2 into DGF
topPRs.author: stevennevins

topPRs.title: configurable delay between game responses
topPRs.author: leopoldjoy
topPRs.body:
**Description**

This PR adds a configurable parameter, `ResponseDelay`, controlling the delay between game responses. Furthermore, a secondary configurable parameter, `ResponseDelayAfter`, is also added, which defines the number of responses after which to start applying the delay.

Finally, the delay configuration is ignored (bypassed) altogether if the current time is already inside the extension period, in order to prevent accidentally waiting beyond the end of a game.

**Tests**

This PR includes a set of unit tests (see [here](https://github.com/leopoldjoy/optimism/blob/feat/configurable-delay-between-game-responses/op-challenger/game/fault/agent_test.go)) and integration tests (see [here](https://github.com/leopoldjoy/optimism/blob/feat/configurable-delay-between-game-responses/op-e2e/faultproofs/response_delay_test.go)) covering the various cases of these new config parameters.

**Additional context**

This new configurable parameter enables intentionally delaying a challenger response to a game in order to make the game progress more slowly. See the thread below for further details on the additional features and their associated motivations.

completedItems.title: op-deployer: add configurable chainIntent.GasLimit field
completedItems.body:
This pr allows users to set a custom gasLimit for each chain in their intent file (via the `chainIntent.GasLimit` field).

When an intent is initialized via `op-deployer init`, the default gasLimit is always set to the `standard.GasLimit`

Their development work, spread across 14 commits, focused on a mix of bug fixes and other feature work.

This work, primarily categorized as bug fixes, involved modifications to documentation and configuration files to ensure a more reliable development pipeline.
